org.sindice.siren.index.codecs.siren10

Class Siren10PostingsWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.lucene.codecs.PostingsConsumer
      • org.apache.lucene.codecs.PostingsWriterBase
        • org.sindice.siren.index.codecs.siren10.Siren10PostingsWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class Siren10PostingsWriter
extends org.apache.lucene.codecs.PostingsWriterBase
    Writes the document identifiers, node frequencies, node labels, term frequencies, term positions and block skip data.

      • startDoc

        public void startDoc(int docID,
            int termDocFreq)
              throws IOException
        Adds a new doc in this term. If this returns null then we just skip consuming positions.

        termDocFreq parameter is ignored as term frequency in document is not used.

        Specified by:
        startDoc in class org.apache.lucene.codecs.PostingsConsumer
        Throws:
        IOException

      • merge

        public org.apache.lucene.codecs.TermStats merge(org.apache.lucene.index.MergeState mergeState,
                                       org.apache.lucene.index.DocsEnum postings,
                                       org.apache.lucene.util.FixedBitSet visitedDocs)
                                         throws IOException
        Default merge impl: append documents, nodes and positions, mapping around deletes.

        Bypass the Siren10PostingsWriter methods and work directly with the BlockWriters for maximum efficiency.

        TODO - Optimisation: If document blocks match the block size, and no document deleted, then it would be possible to copy block directly as byte array, avoiding decoding and encoding.

        Overrides:
        merge in class org.apache.lucene.codecs.PostingsConsumer
        Throws:
        IOException
